extendedIngredients.name: cornstarch
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon cornstarch (plus 1 tablespoon water to mix)

extendedIngredients.name: PB2
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons PB2 (plus 1 tablespoon water to mix)

extendedIngredients.name: peanuts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon peanuts, chopped, plus more for serving

extendedIngredients.name: red pepper flakes
extendedIngredients.originalString: pinch crushed red pepper flakes (or more)

extendedIngredients.name: skinless boneless chicken breast
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound boneless, skinless Chicken Breast, thinly sliced lengthwise

extendedIngredients.name: metal skewers
extendedIngredients.originalString: wood or metal skewers for grilling

recipes.title: Chicken Satay with 1 Point Peanut Sauce

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Buddha Kat Winery Chardonnay with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 25 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Buddha Kat Winery Chardonnay
productMatches.description: We barrel ferment our Chardonnay and age it in a mix of Oak and Stainless. Giving this light bodied wine modest oak character, a delicate floral aroma, and a warming finish.

recipes.instructions: Combine the coconut milk, sugar and spices in a container or ziploc bag. Thinly slice the chicken into long, thin strips.  Combine and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes or overnight. If using wood skewers, soak in a water bath for at least 30 minutes prior to grilling to prevent burning. Thread chicken strips onto skewers. . Grill over medium high heat for 2 minutes per side.Gather ingredients for Peanut Sauce. Chop peanuts and set aside. Combine water with PB2 to create peanut paste. Add half of the chopped peanuts, fish sauce, palm sugar, tamarind and red pepper flakes to peanut paste. Place coconut milk in cold saucepan and heat slowly over medium heat. Add in curry paste and stir until mixed well. Add in peanut paste mixture, stir well and cook for 3 to 5 minutes. Combine cornstarch with water until completely dissolved and pour into saucepan. Stir until dissolved and cook for 2 to 4 minutes until sauce thickens. Remove from heat, let cool for at least 10 minutes and serve with cooked Chicken Satay. Enjoy!

steps.step: Combine the coconut milk, sugar and spices in a container or ziploc bag. Thinly slice the chicken into long, thin strips.

Combine and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes or overnight. If using wood skewers, soak in a water bath for at least 30 minutes prior to grilling to prevent burning. Thread chicken strips onto skewers. . Grill over medium high heat for 2 minutes per side.Gather ingredients for Peanut Sauce. Chop peanuts and set aside.
Combine water with PB2 to create peanut paste.
Add half of the chopped peanuts, fish sauce, palm sugar, tamarind and red pepper flakes to peanut paste.
Place coconut milk in cold saucepan and heat slowly over medium heat.
Add in curry paste and stir until mixed well.
Add in peanut paste mixture, stir well and cook for 3 to 5 minutes.
Combine cornstarch with water until completely dissolved and pour into saucepan. Stir until dissolved and cook for 2 to 4 minutes until sauce thickens.
Remove from heat, let cool for at least 10 minutes and serve with cooked Chicken Satay. Enjoy!
